channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Endowment Syndrome: Why Elite Funds Are Falling Behind
item.description: Endowments have long been considered elite investors, but outdated strategies and skyrocketing costs are eroding their edge

item.title: New York State’s Coming Energy Crisis
item.description: The state only narrowly avoided a major catastrophe two winters ago. Its subpar grid makes a real one all but inevitable.

item.title: Corrupt Media Obsess Over Luigi Mangione After Memory Holing Trump’s Would-Be Assassins
item.description: The media builds a mystique around an alleged murderer while ignoring two gunmen who targeted a presidential candidate.

item.title: GOP Sen. Markwayne Mullin Decries Social Media For Giving Americans Insight Into Congress’s Backdoor Dealmaking
item.description: The Sooner State Republican decried how social media has hampered lawmakers' ability to negotiate on legislation behind closed doors.

item.title: Climbing the Ladder in Finance: The PIE Framework for Investment Professionals
item.description: Promotions require more than just hard work and results. By mastering the PIE framework, you’ll position yourself for long-term career success.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi has hip replacement surgery at a US military hospital in Germany after falling at Battle of the Bulge ceremony
item.description: Pelosi, 84, “is well on the mend,” said Ian Krager, a spokesman for the California Democrat, in a statement.

item.title: When Tariffs Hit: Stocks, Bonds, and Volatility
item.description: Tariff threats are sending analysts' heads spinning. What will be the consequences for stocks, bonds, and volatility?

item.title: ABC agrees to give $15 million to Donald Trump’s presidential library to settle defamation lawsuit
item.description: ABC will also pay $1 million in legal fees to Trump’s lawyer.

item.title: Trump could resurrect his old D.C. hotel
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump is reportedly looking into a deal to bring his former District of Columbia hotel back to life.

item.description: Trump said Nunes will remain the chief executive of Truth Social while leading the advisory panel.

item.title: Dems Call Trump A Threat To Democracy Because He Can Turn Their Lawfare Back On Them
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump is apparently a threat to democracy because he has the power to use the DOJ the way Democrats did against him.

item.title: Trump and members of Congress want drones shot down while more are spotted near military facilities
item.description: The Pentagon said that the military’s initial assessment — that the drones are not of foreign origin — remains unchanged.

item.title: Identity Politics Don’t Belong in Medicine, Either
item.description: In November, Americans rejected identity politics. They should reject identity medicine, too.

item.title: Syria Is a Land of America’s Enemies, and We Should Stay Out
item.description: If our enemies are going to keep warring with each other, let them.

item.title: The fall of Afghanistan’s horse power is a lesson to today’s petrostates: Power based on a strategic commodity is fleeting
item.description: Not so long ago, Afghanistan was the Saudi Arabia of horses. But technological change led to its rapid decline.

item.title: How Team Trump Turned The RNC Into A Get-Out-The-Vote Machine
item.description: The party needed significant reform after having to pick up the pieces from the dismal tenure of Ronna Romney McDaniel.

item.title: By Bowing To The Leftist Mob, Caitlin Clark Abandons Her Most Ardent Defenders
item.description: What Clark fails to realize is that the leftists she's trying to appease will never embrace her.
